org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.requests

Interface RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE_TYPE - The return value type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

    public interface RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    API for internal request implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • asRequest

        Request asRequest()
        Returns the Request implemented by this RequestImpl.
        Returns:
        The Request implemented by this RequestImpl.

      • doSend

        void doSend(ReactorImpl _source,
            AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE> _responseProcessor)
        Passes this Request together with the AsyncResponseProcessor to the target Reactor. Responses are passed back via the targetReactor of the source blades and processed by the provided AsyncResponseProcessor and any exceptions raised while processing the request are processed by the exception handler active when the doSend method was called.
        Parameters:
        _source - The sourceReactor on whose thread this method was invoked and which will buffer this Request and subsequently receive the result for processing on the same thread.
        _responseProcessor - Passed with this request and then returned with the result, the AsyncResponseProcessor is used to process the result on the same thread that originally invoked this method. If null, then no response is returned.

      • isComplete

        boolean isComplete()
        Returns true when a response has been assigned to the request.
        Returns:
        True when a response has not been assigned to the request.

      • isIsolated

        boolean isIsolated()
        Returns true when the request is, directly or indirectly, from an IsolationReactor that awaits a response.
        Returns:
        True whhe request is, directly or indirectly, from an IsolationReactor that awaits a response.

      • eval

        void eval()
        Execute the AsyncRequest.processAsyncRequest method of the request held by the message. This method is always called on the target reactor's own thread.

      • processException

        void processException(ReactorImpl _activeReactor,
                      java.lang.Exception _e)
        Process the exception on the current thread in the facility of the active reactor.
        Parameters:
        _activeReactor - The reactor providing the facility for processing the throwable.
        _e - The exception to be processed.

      • close

        void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

        void cancel()
        Cancel this request.

        boolean isCanceled()
            throws ReactorClosedException
        Returns true if the request has been canceled.
        Returns:
        True if the request has been canceled.
        Throws:
        ReactorClosedException - when the request has been closed.

        boolean _isCanceled()
        Returns true if the request has been canceled.

        Returns true when the target reactor is not the request source.
        Returns:

        Returns true when the request does not pass back a result.

      • isSignal

        Returns true when the request was passed using the signal method.

        Returns the target Reactor.

      • getSourceReactor

        Reactor getSourceReactor()
        Returns the source reactor, or null. A null is returned if the request was passed using the signal or call methods.
        Returns:
        The source reactor or null.

      • responseReceived

        void responseReceived(RequestImpl request)
        A response has been received for a subordinate request.
        Parameters:
        request - A subordinate request.

      • responseProcessed

        void responseProcessed()
        A response value from a subordinate request has been processed.

      • signal

        void signal()
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back. I.E. The signal method results in a 1-way message being passed. If an exception is thrown while processing this Request, that exception is simply logged as a warning.

      • call

        @GwtIncompatible
RESPONSE_TYPE call()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor and blocks the current thread until a result is returned. The call method sends the message directly without buffering, as there is no source reactor. The response message is buffered, though thread migration is not possible.
        Returns:
        The response value from applying this Request to the target reactor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the result is an exception, it is thrown rather than being returned.
